<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/19/amazon-makes-ambitious-environmental-plan?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bezos Leads a Green Wave
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Bezos Leads a Green Wave" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY4OTI3NTIyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This one’s for those of you who take your reusable mugs everywhere, have read the latest IPCC report, and <em>never</em> forget to bring bags to the grocery store. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos rolled out plans to go Packers-green</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He’s calling it the “<a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/19/jeff-bezos-speaks-about-amazon-sustainability-in-washington-dc.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Climate Pledge</a>.” Bezos wants Amazon (+0.22%) to get 80% of its energy from renewable sources by 2024.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>He also called on other companies to join Amazon in going carbon neutral by 2040, a decade ahead of the goals set by the Paris agreement. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">You know what they say about the best laid plans</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">They involve electric vehicles. </strong>Amazon <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/09/19/amazon-orders-100k-electric-delivery-trucks-from-rivian-as-part-of-going-carbon-neutral-by-2040/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will order</a> 100,000 electric trucks from EV startup Rivian as part of the climate plan. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The deal is the largest-ever order of electric delivery vehicles, according to the company.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bezos said Rivian's trucks will hit the road getting you Malcolm Gladwell’s latest starting in 2021. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">These two have history. </strong>Amazon led Rivian’s $700 million investment round in February.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Bezos is facing pressure from the rank and file to do more on climate change. Over 1,500 employees plan to walk out today for the Global Climate Strike. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Next, a Danish company will bring GE’s ginormous wind turbines to U.S. waters</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Another superlative: </strong><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-19/world-s-biggest-wind-turbines-coming-to-u-s-waters-care-of-ge?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">These spinners</a> are the world's tallest and most powerful wind turbines. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The 12-megawatt turbines are almost as tall as the Chrysler Building and will turn wind into laptop juice from just off the coast of Maryland and New Jersey. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">...and could Delta fuel planes with twigs? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The airline <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-18/delta-looks-to-turn-forest-debris-into-fuel-for-its-airplanes?cmpid=BBD091919_OUS&utm_medium=email&utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=190919&utm_campaign=openamericas&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">poured $2 million</a> into a study on the feasibility of a biofuel facility in Washington State. It hopes to finish the research by next year and start delivery of jet fuel made from forest debris by late 2023.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F09%2F19%2Famazon-makes-ambitious-environmental-plan" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STARTUP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/19/stripe-valued-35-billion?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Super Stripe Bros
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Brothers Patrick and John Collison stopped saying “but he started it!” long ago. Stripe, the fintech company the two co-founded in 2010, is <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/09/19/stripe-is-raising-another-250m-at-a-35b-pre-money-valuation/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">now worth $35 billion</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With this latest funding round of $250 million, Patrick (CEO) and John (president) now run the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-19/stripe-becomes-third-most-valuable-startup-in-the-u-s?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">third most valuable startup</a> in the U.S., ahead of giants like Airbnb and Palantir. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stripe’s core business is its payment processing service.</strong> When you use your credit card to book a room on Airbnb or buy a handbag on The RealReal, you’re using Stripe’s technology. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But you don’t become worth $35 billion by staying in your lane, which is why Stripe has expanded into other corners of fintech, including lending and a corporate credit card. Now, everyone from PayPal to Square to unicorn Brex is a competitor. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Your company’s vendors like to say they’re invested in your success, but Stripe really means it. The company’s impressive growth is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/fintech-company-stripe-joins-silicon-valley-elite-with-35-billion-valuation-11568912443?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">directly tied</a> to the success of its e-commerce customers and internet commerce more broadly. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STARTUP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/19/airbnb-announces-ipo-plans?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Fine, Airbnb, You Can Have a Story Too
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Puppy eyes get us every time. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And so do plans to go public. Yesterday, Airbnb <a href="https://press.airbnb.com/airbnb-announces-intention-to-become-a-publicly-traded-company-during-2020/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> its “intention to become a publicly-traded company” in 2020. It's reportedly considering an unconventional direct listing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some stats:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Airbnb was last valued at $31 billion.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This week, Airbnb revealed Q2 revenue was over $1 billion.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It also has </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/19/technology/airbnb-ipo-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">7 million listings</a></span><span> in more than 100,000 cities globally. Somehow, they all seem to have the same Nespresso machine...</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like Stripe, Airbnb has diversified beyond its core business. In 2016, it started offering travelers “Experiences.” And it’s acquired or <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/cf865bb6-daea-11e9-8f9b-77216ebe1f17?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">invested in</a> companies as wide-ranging as HotelTonight and travel site Atlas Obscura. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The IPO market has been rough this year, turning some startup all-stars (Uber and Lyft) into role players and others (WeWork) into benchwarmers.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/19/brands-capitalize-potential-area-51-storming?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
If You Hit Area 52 You’ve Gone Too Far
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="If You Hit Area 52 You’ve Gone Too Far" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY4OTI2OTU1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>zrfphoto/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Grab your alien bayonet, we’re rushing Area 51. Matty Roberts’s viral Facebook event called “Storm Area 51, They Can’t Stop All of Us” <a href="https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/area-51-raid-brands-marketing-trnd/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">designated September 20</a> as the day of days. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Roberts created the event in June as a joke, but its RSVP tally has swelled to 2.1 million. Thousands of people might actually show up in middle-of-nowhere Nevada this weekend.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The owner of a cafe and motel in the tiny town of Alamo, NV, </span><span><a href="https://www.apnews.com/cea7683b09fa478baf071040fa3806eb?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the AP</a></span><span>, </span><span><span>“It’s happening. We already have people from all over the world.”</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What Area 51 is</strong>: Operated by the U.S. Air Force and located 120 miles northwest of Las Vegas, it’s a chunk of Nevada about the size of Connecticut...and also <a href="https://www.vox.com/2019/9/19/20857221/storm-area-51-aliens-ufos-meme-myth-lore-history-bob-lazar-explained?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the site</a> of the U.S.’ overhead surveillance operations. What goes on there is tippity-top-secret, which has made it subject to alien theories. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What the Area 51 storming is...to brands:</strong> An opportunity the size of Nevada. Bud Light <a href="https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/area-51-raid-brands-marketing-trnd/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> limited-edition items like a $100 Bud Light/Area 51 bomber jacket that you cannot buy <a href="https://abgiftshop.com/collections/bud-light-alien?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a> because it sold out. And Arby's sent a food truck on a cross-country road trip to Area 51 base camp. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>In 2019, no trend is too weird or online to be PR stunt-ified.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/19/brews-weekly-news-quiz-september-20?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
I Got 99 Problems but a Quiz Ain't One
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Subscribes to the Brew’s new podcast <em>Business Casual </em>on <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/18090620.293037/aHR0cHM6Ly9wbGF5Lmdvb2dsZS5jb20vbXVzaWMvbGlzdGVuP3Q9QnVzaW5lc3NfQ2FzdWFsJnU9MCZ2aWV3PS9wcy9JbnJvcHJtaXc3bGgydXR0cmp1cXN0ZDcyZmkmdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1tb3JuaW5nX2JyZXc/5cbe3a2524c17c6c936a6f09B79064a64?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Google</a>. Subscribes to <em>Business Casual </em>on <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/18090620.293037/aHR0cHM6Ly9wb2RjYXN0cy5hcHBsZS5jb20vdXMvcG9kY2FzdC9idXNpbmVzcy1jYXN1YWwvaWQxNDgwMDU5Njk3P3V0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3/5cbe3a2524c17c6c936a6f09B53be8461?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a>. Subscribes to <em>Business Casual </em>on <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/18080998.204394/aHR0cHM6Ly9vcGVuLnNwb3RpZnkuY29tL3Nob3cvN25jN09RZFBUZWtFcnRGU1J4T0JLaA/5cb5139efc942d6faa099422Baacfe64e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a>. It’s the Brew’s Weekly News Quiz. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. <strong style="color:#000">Fill in the blanks: </strong>Oil prices shot up Monday after  _____ struck the world’s biggest crude oil processing facility in ________. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. Some tech companies have already released their fall hardware lineups while others are just weeks away. Can you match the product to the company? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Products: </strong></span><span>A dual-screen device codenamed “Centaurus”; Pixel 4 phone; Portal; Fire TV</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Companies: </strong></span><span>Amazon; Google; Microsoft; Facebook </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. Comcast unveiled the name for NBCUniversal’s streaming service Tuesday. What is it?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. This week, the Fed injected more than $100 billion into the U.S. financial system to stabilize the “repo” market on Wall St. What does repo stand for in this context? </p>
<ol type="a">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Repossession </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Repurchase agreements</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Reports  </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Released possums</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5. I was born in Israel. One of my early businesses was a collapsible heel for women’s shoes. I reportedly have the personal goal of becoming the world’s first trillionaire. <strong style="color:#000">Who am I? </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Answers: </em></strong><em>1) Drones, Saudi Arabia 2) Centaurus (Microsoft), Pixel 4 (Google), Portal (Facebook), Fire TV (Amazon) 3) Peacock 4) b. Repurchase agreements 5. WeWork CEO Adam Neumann </em></sup></p>

mugs everywhere, have read the latest IPCC report, and \u003cem\u003enever\u003c/em\u003e forget to bring bags to the grocery store. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAmazon CEO Jeff Bezos rolled out plans to go Packers-green\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHe’s calling it the “\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/19/jeff-bezos-speaks-about-amazon-sustainability-in-washington-dc.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eClimate Pledge\u003c/a\u003e.” Bezos wants Amazon (+0.22%) to get 80% of its energy from renewable sources by 2024.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHe also called on other companies to join Amazon in going carbon neutral by 2040, a decade ahead of the goals set by the Paris agreement. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eYou know what they say about the best laid plans\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThey involve electric vehicles. \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2019/09/19/amazon-orders-100k-electric-delivery-trucks-from-rivian-as-part-of-going-carbon-neutral-by-2040/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill order\u003c/a\u003e 100,000 electric trucks from EV startup Rivian as part of the climate plan. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe deal is the largest-ever order of electric delivery vehicles, according to the company.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBezos said Rivian's trucks will hit the road getting you Malcolm Gladwell’s latest starting in 2021. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThese two have history. \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon led Rivian’s $700 million investment round in February.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eBezos is facing pressure from the rank and file to do more on climate change. Over 1,500 employees plan to walk out today for the Global Climate Strike. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNext, a Danish company will bring GE’s ginormous wind turbines to U.S. waters\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnother superlative: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-19/world-s-biggest-wind-turbines-coming-to-u-s-waters-care-of-ge?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eThese spinners\u003c/a\u003e are the world's tallest and most powerful wind turbines. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe 12-megawatt turbines are almost as tall as the Chrysler Building and will turn wind into laptop juice from just off the coast of Maryland and New Jersey. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e...and could Delta fuel planes with twigs? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe airline \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-18/delta-looks-to-turn-forest-debris-into-fuel-for-its-airplanes?cmpid=BBD091919_OUS\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_term=190919\u0026utm_campaign=openamericas\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epoured $2 million\u003c/a\u003e into a study on the feasibility of a biofuel facility in Washington State. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBrothers Patrick and John Collison stopped saying “but he started it!” long ago. Stripe, the fintech company the two co-founded in 2010, is \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2019/09/19/stripe-is-raising-another-250m-at-a-35b-pre-money-valuation/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enow worth $35 billion\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith this latest funding round of $250 million, Patrick (CEO) and John (president) now run the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-19/stripe-becomes-third-most-valuable-startup-in-the-u-s?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethird most valuable startup\u003c/a\u003e in the U.S., ahead of giants like Airbnb and Palantir. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStripe’s core business is its payment processing service.\u003c/strong\u003e When you use your credit card to book a room on Airbnb or buy a handbag on The RealReal, you’re using Stripe’s technology. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut you don’t become worth $35 billion by staying in your lane, which is why Stripe has expanded into other corners of fintech, including lending and a corporate credit card. Now, everyone from PayPal to Square to unicorn Brex is a competitor. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eYour company’s vendors like to say they’re invested in your success, but Stripe really means it. The company’s impressive growth is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/fintech-company-stripe-joins-silicon-valley-elite-with-35-billion-valuation-11568912443?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edirectly tied\u003c/a\u003e to the success of its e-commerce customers Somehow, they all seem to have the same Nespresso machine...\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike Stripe, Airbnb has diversified beyond its core business. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGrab your alien bayonet, we’re rushing Area 51. Matty Roberts’s viral Facebook event called “Storm Area 51, They Can’t Stop All of Us” \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/area-51-raid-brands-marketing-trnd/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edesignated September 20\u003c/a\u003e as the day of days. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRoberts created the event in June as a joke, but its RSVP tally has swelled to 2.1 million. Thousands of people might actually show up in middle-of-nowhere Nevada this weekend.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe owner of a cafe and motel in the tiny town of Alamo, NV, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.apnews.com/cea7683b09fa478baf071040fa3806eb?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the AP\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“It’s happening. We already have people from all over the world.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat Area 51 is\u003c/strong\u003e: Operated by the U.S. Air Force and located 120 miles northwest of Las Vegas, it’s a chunk of Nevada about the size of Connecticut...and also \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/2019/9/19/20857221/storm-area-51-aliens-ufos-meme-myth-lore-history-bob-lazar-explained?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe site\u003c/a\u003e of the U.S.’ overhead surveillance operations. What goes on there is tippity-top-secret, which has made it subject to alien theories. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat the Area 51 storming is...to brands:\u003c/strong\u003e An opportunity the size of Nevada. Bud Light \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/area-51-raid-brands-marketing-trnd/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e limited-edition items like a $100 Bud Light/Area 51 bomber jacket that you cannot buy \u003ca href=\"https://abgiftshop.com/collections/bud-light-alien?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e because it sold out. And Arby's sent a food truck on a cross-country road trip to Area 51 base camp. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eIn 2019, no trend is too weird or online to be PR stunt-ified.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\"
